intro: Microstylis ehrenbergii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved microstylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Microstylis ehrenbergii typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands.
